snippet: President Ashraf Ghani had promised to have a cabinet in place within 45 days of his inauguration in a coalition with his rival, Abdullah Abdullah.
abstract: Afghan Pres Ashraf Ghani has failed to form new government within 45 days of his inauguration; some Western diplomats express concern that continued inability of Ghani and election rival Abdullah Abdullah to form national unity government could push completion of an Afghanistan cabinet to end of year or beyond.

byline.contributor: Jawad Sukhanyar, Fazal Muzhary and Ahmad Shakib contributed reporting.

lead_paragraph: President Ashraf Ghani had promised to have a cabinet in place within 45 days of his inauguration in a coalition with his rival, Abdullah Abdullah.

headline.main: Afghan Leaders Miss Goal for Choosing Cabinet
headline.print_headline: Afghan Leaders Miss Goal for Choosing Cabinet
